nodes.bodyText: Maybe instead of introducing a new class SupplierUtil.memoized could be used instead?

nodes.bodyText: @dstepanov If you want to create a ProviderUtil.memoized that would be fine. Either way the synchronization logic should be externalized for reusability. The supplier one works well so use that as an example

nodes.bodyText: @dstepanov The util doesn't follow the pattern of SupplierUtil. The crux of the implementation is the delegate gets overridden so it doesn't use synchronization after the first invocation. You can message me on gitter if you'd like more details
